sponsor.partnerMessage: Bowen Dental Studio is a dental office unlike anything you've experienced. Our patients receive personalized, compassionate care from one of the most highly-skilled dentists in the area. We prioritize listening to and caring for our patients to build long-term relationships with them and help them reach their dental goals. Learn more here.

posts.title: Weekend Roundup
posts.content:
One wheel: Witness the biggest Onewheel gathering on the planet full of races and surely epic falls.

Get your popcorn: The new Space Jam and Cry Macho are at the drive in this weekend.

Smash it: The Fall Demolition Derby is in Springdale this Saturday.

BBQ: Head over to Rogers for the 6th annual Frisco Inferno Barbecue Competition & Tasting.

Jazz story: The No Tears Suite performance is free at the Fayetteville Public Library tonight.

Two wheels: Check out the vintage motorcycle show in Fayetteville and benefit Canopy NWA.

Jerry world: The 16th ranked Hogs take on the 7th ranked Aggies in the Southwest Classic in Arlington.

Head bobbin': As always, we've got an array of live music happening in our little region. Here's a list.

posts.title: Made By Hand
posts.content:
When local makers gather in one place it reveals how many creative people are in our midst. 

  • Market: Hosted by Fifth Street Studio, the Fifth Street Makers Market will be at Airship Coffee on 5th St. in Bentonville tomorrow, and it's going to be bigger than ever before. The line up consists of 27 vendors showcasing things like pottery, candles, clothing, woodwork and so much more. 
  • Bonus: DJ Ryan Story and Taylor Ingred will be providing tunes, and Airship will be releasing a preview of its fall menu. The event will run from 4-9p. Biking/walking to the market is highly encouraged, because it’s just better for you, and parking is limited. 

Take a Makers Market sneak peak HERE.

posts.title: Fall Vacation Anyone?
posts.content:
With the fading of summer, air travel from XNA has slowed due to the responsibilities that come along with fall, but one thing has stayed the same: the low fare trips to locations all over the country. 

  • Traveling again: There has been a general decline in passengers due to the pandemic, but numbers are on the up and up. XNA reported more than twice the number of people boarded flights this August than last. 
  • Incentive to go: At the end of August XNA was 8,000 passengers short of the total amount of passengers in 2020. With the cost of flights staying low, the airport projects more than 500,000 passengers in 2021.

Read the full Fare Flight article HERE.

posts.title: Cool Jobs in NWA
posts.content:
Looking for a job? Check out these new jobs posted to our community board this week:

  • Canopy NWA is seeking an Employment Specialist and a Career Navigator to help refugees with employment and career advancement.
  • Harps Food Stores is looking for a full-time graphic designer.
  • Milestone Leadership has an opening for an Operations Coordinator to help support their team.

Have a job you're looking to fill? Post it here for FREE, and we might feature it next week!

posts.title: Levels of Success
posts.content:
After the Supreme Court verdict this past summer in Alston vs. NCAA, student athletes are no longer limited on the education benefits they can receive. Which means, athletes can get paid for doing well in school. 

  • Localized: As of an announcement yesterday (Sept. 23), Razorback athletes “may receive money for their academic success” as a part of The Razorback Academic Success Initiative. 
  • Holistic success: The initiative ramps up more than ever the incentive for advancement toward a degree, as the University of Arkansas athletic department is invested in the education of its student athletes. 

Read the full announcement for more details HERE.

pick.title: NWA Daily Picks
pick.content:
• Eat local: Avoid beef shortages in the store, get pasture-raised beef straight from the source with Eat Local Beef.*
  • Weekend fun: The #NWAChampionship is having its final days this weekend. Get tickets HERE, or email us, we have some!*
  • Grab the mic: Kids sing free all day on Sundays at Big Box Karaoke!*
  • Free Show: GRAMMY award winning artist Grace Potter will be on the Momentary Green, Sept. 30.
  • Down to business: Vote for Arkansas Money & Politics Top 3 businesses to be featured in the November edition.
  • Council: The default speed limit in Fayetteville might change.
  • High School: Someone brought a chopper to class on Wednesday.
  • Connect: Reach thousands of your neighbors with us. Check out our advertising packages.
